sen.j: 貴船口駅（きぶねぐちえき）は、京都府京都市左京区鞍馬貴船町にある、叡山電鉄叡山電鉄鞍馬線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Kurama Kibune-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Kibuneguchi Station is a stop on the Kurama Line, which is operated by Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Kibuneguchi Station, located in Kurama Kibune-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kurama Line, which is operated by Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
Kibuneguchi Station, located in Kurama Kibune-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Kurama Line, which is operated by Eizan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 叡山電鉄→Eizan Electric Railway としました。

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 片面ホーム1面1線の無人駅である。
sen.e: It is an unmanned station having a platform only one side of which is used for a track.
It's an unmanned station having a platform only one side of which is used for track service.
It's an unmanned station having a platform only one side of which is used for track service.

sen.j: 春秋等の観光シーズンや観光客が多い週末など、混雑時は駅員が駐在する。
sen.e: It has a station attendant stationed in busy periods including spring and fall sightseeing seasons, and weekends on which the large number of visitors is expected.
A station attendant is present during busy periods, including the spring and fall sightseeing seasons as well as weekends in which large numbers of visitors are expected.
A station attendant is present during busy periods, including the spring and fall sightseeing seasons as well as weekends in which large numbers of visitors are expected.

sen.j: その対応として普段は無人駅ながらスルッとKANSAI共通カード対応自動改札機（ゲートがないタイプ）が設置されており、その脇には係員詰所もある。
sen.e: To deal with many visitors, an automatic ticket checker (with no gate) for KANSAI THRU PASS is set up and a station attendant resides next to the automatic ticket checker.
sen.cmt: 設置される自動改札機の数は1台、また駐在する駅員は1人として訳出しております。
sen.e: To handle the many visitors, an automatic ticket checker (with no gate) for KANSAI THRU PASS is set up, and a station attendant resides next to it.
To handle the many visitors, an automatic ticket checker (with no gate) for KANSAI THRU PASS is set up, and a station attendant resides next to it.

sen.j: 駅ホームは一部、鞍馬川・貴船川の合流点付近および、京都府道361号上黒田貴船線の鉄橋上に存在する。
sen.e: A part of the platform is located near the meeting point of Kurama-gawa River and Kibune-gawa River and above the iron bridge of Kyoto Prefecture Road 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line
A portion of the platform is located near the meeting point of the Kurama-gawa and Kibune-gawa rivers and above the iron bridge of Kyoto Prefectural Road 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line.
A portion of the platform is located near the meeting point of the Kurama-gawa and Kibune-gawa rivers and above the iron bridge of Kyoto Prefectural Route 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line.
sen.cmt: 府道→prefectural route としました。

sen.j: 主な出入口は府道の貴船側に沿ってあり、駅への上り口に自動券売機が設置されていて、駅員が配置されている時などには稼動する。
sen.e: The main entrance is located along the Kibune side of the Kyoto Prefecture Road and an automatic ticket vending machine is set up at the foot of the station, which only works when a station attendant is present.

The main entrance is located along the Kibune side of the Kyoto Prefectural Road, and an automatic ticket vending machine is set up at the foot of the station, but it is operated only when a station attendant is present.

The main entrance is located along the Kibune side of the Kyoto Prefectural Route, and an automatic ticket vending machine is set up at the foot of the station, but it is operated only when a station attendant is present.
sen.cmt: 府道→prefectural route としました。

sen.j: その隣には売店が入居しており、そこから階段を登ったところにホームがある。
sen.e: There is a shop next to the automatic ticket vending machine and the platform is located up on the stairs extending from the shop.
There is a shop next to the automatic ticket vending machine, and the platform is located at the top of the stairway extending from the shop.
There is a shop next to the automatic ticket vending machine, and the platform is located at the top of the stairway extending from the shop.

sen.j: 売店脇からホームに向って左側に下ったところにトイレが設置されていて、その先は鞍馬小学校方面への通路となり、木々に包まれた鉄橋やホームを見上げることができる。
sen.e: There is a bathroom down the stairs to the left toward the platform from the shop side, and the passage is extending to the direction of Kurama Elementary School, from which the iron bridge and the platform, surrounded by trees, can be looked up.

There is a bathroom downstairs and to the left, toward the platform from the shop side; the passage leads in the direction of Kurama Elementary School, from which the iron bridge and the platform, surrounded by trees, can be seen.

There is a bathroom downstairs and to the left, toward the platform from the shop side; the passage leads in the direction of Kurama Elementary School, from which the iron bridge and the platform, surrounded by trees, can be seen.

sen.j: 駅自体の立地上、車椅子等での利用は困難。
sen.e: It is basically not a wheelchair-accessible station because of its locational factor.
Due to its location, the station is basically not wheelchair-accessible.
Due to its location, the station is basically not wheelchair-accessible.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 京都府道38号京都広河原美山線（鞍馬街道）から京都府道361号上黒田貴船線が分岐したすぐ先に位置している。
sen.e: This station is located on Kyoto Prefecture Road 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line, just ahead from where it diverges from Kyoto Prefecture Road 38, the Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama Kaido Road).
sen.cmt: これは「駅周辺」の項の文章ですが、「・・・に位置している」ものは、「当駅」（貴船口駅）であるという判断で訳出いたしました。
sen.e: The station is located on Kyoto Prefectural Road 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line, just past the point at which it diverges from Kyoto Prefectural Road 38, the Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama Kaido Road).

The station is located on Kyoto Prefectural Route 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line, just past the point at which it diverges from Kyoto Prefectural Route 38, the Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama Kaido Road).
sen.cmt: 府道→prefectural route としました。

sen.j: 貴船神社まではこの駅から徒歩20分程の距離があり、下記路線バスに乗らない場合は、狭い道路を歩かなければならない。
sen.e: To go to Kibune-jinja Shrine, which is about 20-munite walk away from this station, a person needs to walk on a narrow road unless taking the buses to be mentioned later.
To reach Kibune-jinja Shrine, which is a walk of approximately 20 minutes from the station, one must take a narrow road or otherwise ride a bus, as mentioned later.
To reach Kibune-jinja Shrine, which is a walk of approximately 20 minutes from the station, one must take a narrow road or otherwise ride a bus, as mentioned later.

sen.j: シーズン中は自動車の通行も多く注意が必要である。
sen.e: There is a lot of traffic during busy times, and thus walking on the road requires careful attention.
The traffic is considerable during busy times, so walking on the road requires careful attention.
The traffic is considerable during busy times, so walking on the road requires careful attention.

sen.j: （京都府道361号上黒田貴船線）の項も参照されたい。
sen.e: Also refer to the section of (Kyoto Prefecture Road 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line).
Additionally, refer to the section of (Kyoto Prefectural Road 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line).
Additionally, refer to the section of (Kyoto Prefectural Route 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line).
sen.cmt: 府道→prefectural route としました。

sen.j: 周囲には鞍馬小学校と消防出張所以外には目立った施設はない。
sen.e: There are no noticeable facilities except Kurama Elementary School and the Fire Station Branch.
There are no noticeable facilities except Kurama Elementary School and the Fire Station Branch.
There are no noticeable facilities except Kurama Elementary School and the Fire Station Branch.

sen.j: 京都府道361号上黒田貴船線
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture Road 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line
Kyoto Prefectural Road 361, the Kamikuroda Kibune Line
Kyoto Prefectural Route 361: Kamikuroda Kibune Line
sen.cmt: 府道→prefectural route としました。

sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture Road 38, the Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama Kaido Road)
Kyoto Prefectural Road 38, the Kyoto Hirogawara Miyama Line (Kurama Kaido Road)

sen.j: かじとりはし（上記2つの府道の分岐点にある朱塗りの橋）
sen.e: Kajitori-hashi Bridge (a vermilion-lacquered bridge located at the fork of the above-mentioned two prefectural roads)
Kajitori-hashi Bridge (a vermilion-lacquered bridge located at the fork of the above-mentioned two prefectural roads)
Kajitori-hashi Bridge (a vermilion-lacquered bridge located at the fork of the above-mentioned two prefectural routes)
sen.cmt: 府道→prefectural route としました。

sen.j: 蛍岩（ゲンジボタル生息地、徒歩2分）
sen.e: Hotaru Iwa Rock (a habitat of Genji fireflies, a two-minute walk away)
Hotaru Iwa Rock (a habitat of Genji fireflies, a two-minute walk away)
Hotaru Iwa Rock (a habitat of Genji fireflies, a two-minute walk away)

sen.e: Daikan-shoten Shop (which sets up a shop in Kibuneguchi Station and sells commutation tickets on commission)
Daikan-shoten Shop (which sets up a shop in Kibuneguchi Station and sells commuter tickets on a commission basis)
Daikan-shoten Shop (which sets up a shop in Kibuneguchi Station and sells commuter tickets on a commission basis)

sen.j: 「貴船もみじ灯篭」（11月に開催）の際は、駅構内の紅葉がライトアップされる。
sen.e: The autumn leaves in the station yard are illuminated for the Kibune Momiji Toro Festival (held in every November)
The autumn leaves in the station yard are illuminated for the Kibune Momiji Toro Festival, which is held each November.
The autumn leaves in the station yard are illuminated for the Kibune Momiji Toro Festival, which is held each November.

sen.e: Kyoto Bus system 33: For Kibune (seasonally-varying time schedule; For 2008, it is operated everyday between March 20 and December 7.)

Kyoto Bus Route 33: For Kibune (seasonally varying time schedule; for 2008, it was operated daily between March 20 and December 7)

sen.e: Kibune-guchi (from the station exit, passing the iron bridge under the platform, along Kurama Kaido Road ahead of the bridge)

sen.e: Kyoto Bus system 95: Kitayama Birdie - Ohara (operated only on Saturdays and holidays between Vernal Equinox Day and November 30)

sen.j: 1929年（昭和4年）10月20日 鞍馬電気鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: October 20, 1929: Started as a station of Kurama Denki Tetsudo Railway.
October 20, 1929: The station opened as a facility of the Kurama Denki Tetsudo Railway.
October 20, 1929: The station opened as a facility of the Kurama Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 鞍馬電気鉄道→Kurama Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）8月1日 会社合併により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: August 1, 1942: As a result of the business consolidation, the station became under control of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd..
August 1, 1942: As a result of the business consolidation, it was placed under the control of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
August 1, 1942: As a result of the business consolidation, it was placed under the control of Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 1986年（昭和61年）4月1日 会社再編により叡山電鉄の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1986: As a result of the company reorganization, the station became under control of Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
April 1, 1986: As a result of the company reorganization, the station became under the control of Eizan-dentetsu (Eizan Electric Railway).
April 1, 1986: As a result of the company reorganization, the station became under the control of Eizan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: 叡山電鉄→Eizan Electric Railway としました。
